node.title: Qantas adds non-stop Perth to Rome flights after border open date is revealed
node.alt: A Qantas A380 flies in the sky
node.description: A direct flight to Rome will complement the non-stop London route as the state readies for international travel in the wake of WA's border announcement.
node.content: ["Qantas has added a non-stop flight to Rome to its schedule from June just days after the West Australian government announced its border opening date on February 5.", "Tickets are already on sale for the new flight which will complement the direct Perth-to-London route, which is set to resume in\u00a0April.", "The Rome flight will operate three times a week, starting on Wednesday June 22.", "\u201cDirect flights connecting Perth with Rome will be a game-changer for WA\u2019s economy as Western Australia safely re-engages with the world,\" Premier Mark McGowan said.", "\u201cMany Western Australians have family links with Italy and it will now be easier to safely reunite after so long apart.\"", "Qantas had delayed the announcement of routes In September after the WA government indicated borders\u00a0would not be open for Christmas travel.", "More to come."]
